column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication several years ago for tension headaches.  It was helpful, but not dramatic.Recently I became a sufferer of back pain.  What an absolute drag that is!  I had some metaxalone 800mg and I'm using it routinely.  I just put it in with my regular 7a/2p/10p medications and it's very effective.  Using it "as needed" wasn't so successful as I would let my back begin to seriously spasm before taking the medication and with a half hour or so before it became effective, I didn't feel it was much help.  The routine use has been the answer for me.

column2: Zoe girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a fall victim who hit hard tile. While trying to help the headaches I started Metaxalone and could not sleep, lay down or sit up, I felt numb and sort or "out of body" sensation from hips down. The second day I am experiencing nervous shaking of my legs like crazy.  This is a strange overall feeling.  No headache, but I do not care for the side effects.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
ybsane, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been very lucky using this drug for my severe back spasms. My back spasms are due to an injury sustained when my bicycle collided with a Tundra pickup that turned in front of me. Humans don't make good hood ornaments. Before taking metaxalone, I was going 2 and 3 days without sleep because I couldn't lay down. This had been going on for about 3 months. I was at wit's end, what little was left. I can take metaxalone on an empty stomach or with food, and I haven't really noticed that it makes me feel drowsy either. So far, taking between 2 pills to 4 pills a day, depending on the duration of the spasms, I've not noticed any side-effects...so far. And I'm hoping it stays that way.

column2: Birdie 18, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have had promblems with my lower back for over twenty years, I am very active and my lower back muscles will spasm,and I will be out for 5-10 days recovering. This will happen 2-3 times a year every year. I have been on metaxal for the last two years on a as need basis, Example when I feel my back getting tight just before I pull it out I will Take a metaxal and a celebrex and my back will feel fine one hour later. No back spasm for two years now.
